page.title: 01THE CHRISTCHURCH AREA
page.content: {Christchurch}is situated on the eastern side of the{Bournemouth conurbation. It is about 7miles from {Poole,}and about 5 miles from Bournemouth.To the east is the{New {Forest,}some 5 miles away.The town centre is situated between two rivers, the{Avon}and the{Stour.}The two rivers join in{Christchurch Harbour}before flowing out into the sea. Christchurch's original name was {Tweoxneam}which later became{Twynham which means "town between two rivers".The name was said to have changed when the{Priory Church was built.The town centre has many shops, including a new precinct called {Saxon Square}which was built on the site of an old settlement. Tourism is important, with many attractions including a castle and local beaches.
